TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {1175247=Depending on the results from the Kentucky Derby and Preakness Stakes races the Belmont Stakes can vary from huge excitement to a laid back race. The time leading up to the event will be total madness with the media and horse racing fans from all over the world if only one winner emerges from these first two legs, with the possibilty to witness the coronation of a Triple Crown winner since 1978., 747400=Classic Division: Pacific Classic Sprint Division: Pat O'Brien Mile Division: Del Mar Mile, 1177709=Home of Pimlico Race course where the second leg of the world-famous thoroughbred Triple Crown races, the Preakness Stakes, are held every third weekend of May. Maryland Thoroughbred Race Tracks: Pimlico Race Course Laurel Park Maryland Harness Race Tracks: Ocean Downs Race Track Rosecroft Raceway Other Horse Racing Tracks Arizona Race Tracks California Race Tracks Florida Race Tracks Illinois Race Tracks Kentucky Race Tracks New York Race Tracks More America Racetracks, 1176078=The inaugural running of Belmont Stake's was in 1867 at Jerome Park Recourse. It is the fourth oldest race overall in North America and the oldest of the Triple Crown races, it predates the Preakness by six years and the Kentucky Derby by eight. ., 1176339=The Belmont Stakes is run on the first Saturday of June, the first running took place on a Thursday at a mile and five furlongs, with an entry fee of $200 half forfeit with $1,500 added. The Belmont was transferred from Jerome Park to Morris Park in 1890, it was to stay there until 1905 when the Belmont Park was opened.}
textBeforeTable: Not even legendary entertainers Bing Crosby and Pat O'Brien could have fathomed what their vision, Del Mar Race Course, would become; the highlight of the California thoroughbred racing season. Like Saratoga in the East, Del Mar is world renown for its juvenile racing and world class stakes fare. Del Mar Stakes Schedule -->
